data.title: Top Movies and TV Shows
data.meta_description: The best movies and TV shows from Oliver Platt's filmography. Learn what television and films they've been in, sorted by overall online popularity on Television Stats.
data.text:
The Bear

as Uncle Jimmy 'Cicero' Kalinowski • 8 episode s • # 4 most popular show

The Bear is an American television series that weaves comedy and drama, following a young fine-dining chef named Carmy who returns to his hometown of Chicago to take over his family's sandwich shop after his brother's passing. Tasked with revitalizing the establishment, Carmy and his eclectic team dive into the pressures of the restaurant world, balancing their personal lives and relationships within the backdrop of a bustling kitchen.

Fargo

as Stavros Milos • 5 episode s • # 103 most popular show

Fargo is an American black comedy-crime drama anthology television series. Each season follows an independent storyline with a different set of characters and a new case. The show is inspired by the 1996 film of the same name, which was written and directed by the Coen brothers. Set in various locations in the Midwestern United States, Fargo explores themes of greed, violence, and the quirky small-town culture. With its dark humor and gripping storytelling, Fargo has garnered critical acclaim and a dedicated fanbase.

Chicago Fire

as Dr. Daniel Charles • 6 episode s • # 128 most popular show

Chicago Fire is an American action-drama television series that takes place in the high-stakes environment of the Chicago Fire Department. The series showcases the interconnected lives of firefighters, paramedics, and rescue workers dealing with high-pressure jobs while balancing personal and family issues.

Chicago Fire

as Daniel Charles • 2 episode s • # 128 most popular show

Chicago Fire is an American action-drama television series that takes place in the high-stakes environment of the Chicago Fire Department. The series showcases the interconnected lives of firefighters, paramedics, and rescue workers dealing with high-pressure jobs while balancing personal and family issues.

Modern Family

as Martin • 2 episode s • # 134 most popular show

Modern Family is a critically acclaimed sitcom that follows the lives of Jay Pritchett and his family in suburban Los Angeles. The series takes a humorous and often heartwarming look at the everyday challenges and triumphs faced by three diverse households. Through a mockumentary style, the show explores the ups and downs of Jay's traditional family, his daughter's mixed marriage, and his son's unconventional household. With its relatable characters and witty writing, Modern Family offers a fresh and entertaining perspective on modern-day family dynamics.

Chicago P.D.

as Daniel Charles • 4 episode s • # 176 most popular show

Chicago P.D. is an American police procedural drama television series that follows the Intelligence Unit of the 21st District of the Chicago Police Department. Led by the determined and dedicated Sergeant Hank Voight, the elite team combats the city's most heinous crimes, including organized crime, drug trafficking, and high-profile murders. The series offers a gripping portrayal of the challenges faced by law enforcement officers as they navigate through the complex and dangerous world of Chicago's streets.

Chicago Med

as Dr. Daniel Charles • 176 episode s • # 203 most popular show

Chicago Med is a thrilling medical drama that takes place in the fast-paced and intense world of Chicago's busiest hospital. With a talented cast of doctors, nurses, and staff, the show follows the lives and cases of the dedicated medical professionals as they navigate the high-stakes world of emergency medicine. From life-saving procedures to complex diagnoses, Chicago Med provides an authentic and gripping portrayal of the daily challenges faced by the medical team. With its compelling storylines and compassionate characters, this series offers a compelling and informative look into the world of medicine.

The West Wing

as Oliver Babish • 7 episode s • # 277 most popular show

The West Wing is a political drama television series that follows the inner workings of the White House under the presidency of fictional President Josiah Bartlet. The show explores the personal and professional lives of the President and his staff as they navigate the complex corridors of power, tackle pressing political issues, and grapple with the challenges of leadership. With its fast-paced dialogue, compelling storylines, and a talented ensemble cast, The West Wing offers an insightful and captivating portrayal of American politics.

Jimmy Kimmel Live!

1 episode • # 541 most popular show

Jimmy Kimmel Live! is a nightly American talk show that blends comedy, celebrity interviews, and live musical performances. Hosted by comedian Jimmy Kimmel, the show airs on ABC and is known for its humorous take on current events and popular culture.

Nip/Tuck

3 episode s • # 708 most popular show

Nip/Tuck is a riveting television drama that follows the lives of skilled plastic surgeons, Dr. Sean McNamara and Dr. Christian Troy. As they navigate their successful careers, they find themselves entangled in full-blown midlife crises, facing a multitude of challenges related to their work, family dynamics, and romantic relationships. With a captivating blend of drama and introspection, this show delves deep into the complexities of their lives, uncovering personal and professional struggles along the way.

American Experience

as Narrator (voice) • 4 episode s • # 1,141 most popular show

American Experience is a television series aired on PBS that explores significant events and personalities in American history through detailed documentaries. Each episode seeks to present an in-depth look at the influences and developments that have shaped the United States, providing viewers with a comprehensive understanding of the nation's past and its cultural impact.

American Experience

as Narrator • 2 episode s • # 1,141 most popular show

American Experience is a television series aired on PBS that explores significant events and personalities in American history through detailed documentaries. Each episode seeks to present an in-depth look at the influences and developments that have shaped the United States, providing viewers with a comprehensive understanding of the nation's past and its cultural impact.

2012

as Carl Anheuser • # 333 most popular movie

2012 is a 2009 American science fiction disaster film directed by Roland Emmerich. It follows the story of Dr. Adrian Helmsley and writer Jackson Curtis as they discover and try to survive an impending global catastrophe caused by unprecedented natural disasters.

Love & Other Drugs

as Bruce Winston • # 599 most popular movie

Love & Other Drugs is a 2010 American romantic comedy-drama film directed by Edward Zwick, based on Jamie Reidy's book Hard Sell: The Evolution of a Viagra Salesman. Starring Jake Gyllenhaal and Anne Hathaway, the film follows the evolving relationship between a pharmaceutical sales representative and a free-spirited woman, influenced by the ultimate drug: love.

Indecent Proposal

as Jeremy • # 1,483 most popular movie

Indecent Proposal is a 1993 American erotic drama film that revolves around a wealthy businessman's proposition to a financially struggling couple, offering a million dollars in exchange for a night with the wife.

Chef

as Ramsey Michel • # 1,775 most popular movie

Chef is a 2014 American road comedy-drama film about Chef Carl Casper, who starts a food truck after quitting his job at a Los Angeles restaurant. Teaming up with his ex-wife, friend, and son, Chef Carl embarks on a journey to rediscover his culinary passion.

Beethoven

as Harvey • # 1,920 most popular movie

Beethoven is a 1992 American family comedy film about a St. Bernard puppy who becomes a beloved part of the Newton family, despite the disapproval of the father. The film was a surprise box office success and led to a franchise including a sequel and animated TV series.

Working Girl

as Lutz • # 1,941 most popular movie

Working Girl is a 1988 American romantic comedy-drama film that follows the story of Tess McGill, an ambitious secretary who seizes an opportunity to advance her career when her boss is incapacitated. With a blend of ambition and determination, Tess navigates the corporate world to make her mark.

Lake Placid

as Hector Cyr • # 2,045 most popular movie

Lake Placid is a 1999 American comedy horror film about a giant crocodile terrorizing the fictional location of Black Lake, Maine. A dysfunctional group of police and scientists attempt to capture or kill the beast, leading to unexpected alliances and intense encounters.

Bicentennial Man

as Rupert Burns • # 2,668 most popular movie

Bicentennial Man is a 1999 American science fiction comedy-drama film about a robot named Andrew who evolves to experience emotions and creative thought, challenging the notion of what it means to be human.

Frost/Nixon

as Bob Zelnick • # 2,741 most popular movie

Frost/Nixon is a 2008 historical drama film that delves into the revealing interviews between British television broadcaster David Frost and former United States President Richard Nixon in 1977. The film received critical acclaim and was directed by Ron Howard, earning five Oscar nominations, including Best Picture and Best Director.

Year One

as High Priest • # 3,163 most popular movie

Year One is a 2009 American adventure comedy film directed by Harold Ramis. The plot follows two cavemen banished from their tribe as they embark on a journey through the ancient world. It is a parody on the book of Genesis and features encounters with biblical figures.

Executive Decision

as Cahill • # 3,451 most popular movie

Executive Decision is a 1996 American action thriller film directed by Stuart Baird. It stars Kurt Russell as intelligence expert David Grant, who becomes part of a special assault team to intercept terrorists hijacking a 747 bound for Washington D.C.

Letters to Juliet

as New Yorker Magazine Editor Bobby (uncredited) • # 3,497 most popular movie

Letters to Juliet is a 2010 American romantic comedy-drama film about a young American woman who embarks on a quest to find the lovers mentioned in an unanswered 'letter to Juliet' left in Juliet's courtyard in Verona, Italy. The film stars Amanda Seyfried, Christopher Egan, Gael García Bernal, Vanessa Redgrave, and Franco Nero.

Bulworth

as Dennis Murphy • # 3,837 most popular movie

Bulworth is a 1998 American political satire black comedy film that follows a disillusioned liberal politician, Senator Jay Billington Bulworth, who hires an assassin to kill him so he can speak openly and honestly with his constituents using hip-hop culture.

Ready to Rumble

as Jimmy King • # 3,863 most popular movie

Ready to Rumble is a 2000 American buddy comedy sports film that revolves around two devoted wrestling fans who are deeply affected by the unjust removal of their beloved wrestling icon by a corrupt promoter.

Rules Don't Apply

as Forester • # 3,871 most popular movie

Rules Don't Apply is a 2016 American romantic comedy-drama film based on the life of businessman and film producer Howard Hughes. The story is set in 1958 Hollywood and follows the forbidden love between an actress and her driver, defying Hughes' strict rules. Directed and produced by Warren Beatty, the film features an ensemble cast including Beatty, Annette Bening, Matthew Broderick, Lily Collins, and Alden Ehrenreich. Released in 2016, it received mixed reviews and had a disappointing box office performance.

Married to the Mob

as Ed Benitez • # 3,955 most popular movie

Married to the Mob is a 1988 American crime comedy film featuring Michelle Pfeiffer as Angela de Marco, a mafia widow from Brooklyn, who becomes entangled with an undercover FBI agent investigating her connections to the mob.

Benny & Joon

as Eric • # 4,155 most popular movie

Benny & Joon is a 1993 American romantic comedy-drama film that follows the relationship between a mentally ill young woman named Juniper "Joon" and an eccentric man named Sam, who is inspired by silent film comedians like Buster Keaton.

Kinsey

as Herman Wells • # 4,419 most popular movie

Kinsey is a 2004 American biographical drama film directed by Bill Condon. It depicts the life of Alfred Charles Kinsey, a pioneering figure in the field of sexology. The film delves into Kinsey's publication of 'Sexual Behavior in the Human Male', which was one of the earliest attempts to scientifically investigate human sexual behavior. The movie stars Liam Neeson, Laura Linney, Chris O'Donnell, Peter Sarsgaard, Timothy Hutton, John Lithgow, Tim Curry, and Oliver Platt.

Don't Say a Word

as Dr. Louis Sachs • # 4,649 most popular movie

Don't Say a Word is a 2001 American psychological thriller film based on the novel Don't Say a Word by Andrew Klavan. Starring Michael Douglas, Brittany Murphy, and Sean Bean, the story revolves around a psychiatrist whose daughter is kidnapped, and he must unlock the mind of a traumatized young woman to save her.

Shut In

as Dr. Wilson • # 4,827 most popular movie

Shut In (Oppression) is a 2016 psychological horror thriller film directed by Farren Blackburn. The story revolves around a widowed child psychologist residing in rural New England. Trapped in an isolated existence, she must confront her own fears and struggles when a fierce winter storm strands her with a young boy who goes missing. Starring Naomi Watts, Oliver Platt, Charlie Heaton, Jacob Tremblay, David Cubitt, and Clémentine Poidatz, Shut In combines elements of suspense, psychological tension, and supernatural mystery to deliver a chilling cinematic experience.

Dangerous Beauty

as Maffio Venier • # 4,896 most popular movie

Dangerous Beauty is a 1998 American biographical drama film depicting the story of Veronica Franco, a courtesan in sixteenth-century Venice who defies social norms to become a renowned figure in her city.

Three to Tango

as Peter Steinberg • # 5,613 most popular movie

Three to Tango is a 1999 romantic comedy film about architects Oscar and Peter who compete for a career-making opportunity to design a cultural center. A wealthy tycoon mistakenly believes Oscar is gay and asks him to spy on his mistress Amy, leading to unexpected romantic complications.

Funny Bones

as Tommy Fawkes • # 5,668 most popular movie

Funny Bones is a 1995 comedy-drama film featuring Tommy Fawkes, a comedian struggling to find success. Following a failed debut in Las Vegas, he returns to Blackpool to reconnect with his comedic roots.

The Ice Harvest

as Pete Van Heuten • # 5,737 most popular movie

The Ice Harvest is a 2005 American neo-noir black comedy film directed by Harold Ramis, based on the 2000 novel by Scott Phillips. It stars John Cusack, Billy Bob Thornton, and Connie Nielsen, with Randy Quaid and Oliver Platt in supporting roles.

Pieces of April

as Jim Burns • # 6,305 most popular movie

Pieces of April is a 2003 American comedy-drama film that follows April Burns, a rebellious young woman living in a New York City apartment. Upon learning about her mother's illness, she decides to invite her emotionally distant family for Thanksgiving dinner, despite their strained relationships.

The Ten

as Marc Jacobson • # 6,400 most popular movie

The Ten is a 2007 comedy anthology film that consists of ten stories, each inspired by one of the Ten Commandments. Directed by David Wain and co-written with Ken Marino, the film was released on August 3, 2007, through ThinkFilm. It received mixed reviews.

Please Give

as Alex • # 6,663 most popular movie

Please Give is a 2010 dark comedy film directed by Nicole Holofcener, starring Catherine Keener. The story follows a couple in New York City who clash with the granddaughters of the elderly woman living in the apartment they own.
